BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Wind slabs and weakly bonded old snow represent the main danger.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The fresh and older wind slabs are lying on weak layers especially on east to north to northwest facing aspects above approximately 2400 m. Skiers can release avalanches in isolated cases, with a large load in most cases, in particular in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain on very steep slopes. Mostly the avalanches are only small.

In addition as the day progresses on south, southeast and southwest facing slopes, further individual mostly small moist and wet avalanches are possible. This applies in particular in case of releases originating from very steep starting zones at intermediate and high altitudes that have retained the snow thus far.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
In some regions 2 to 10 cm of snow, but less in some localities, fell on Sunday above approximately 2000 m. The sleet gave rise to moistening of the snowpack in all aspects below approximately 2300 m. As a consequence of highly fluctuating temperatures and rain a crust formed on the surface at the weekend.
Weak layers exist in the old snowpack on shady slopes.
Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to moistening of the snowpack on very steep south facing slopes at intermediate altitudes. These conditions will foster a gradual strengthening of the snowpack especially below approximately 3000 m. At low and intermediate altitudes from a snow sport perspective, insufficient snow is lying. The numerous rocks hidden by the recent snow are the main danger.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The weather conditions will foster a gradual change towards better conditions in all regions. The avalanche danger will decrease gradually.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Wind slabs and weakly bonded old snow represent the main danger.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The fresh and older wind slabs are lying on weak layers especially on east to north to northwest facing aspects above approximately 2400 m. Skiers can release avalanches in isolated cases, with a large load in most cases, in particular in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain on very steep slopes. In isolated cases the avalanches are medium-sized.

In addition as the day progresses on south, southeast and southwest facing slopes, further individual mostly small moist and wet avalanches are possible. This applies in particular in case of releases originating from very steep starting zones at intermediate and high altitudes that have retained the snow thus far.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
In some regions 10 to 25 cm of snow, but less in some localities, fell on Sunday above approximately 2300 m. The sleet gave rise to moistening of the snowpack in all aspects below approximately 2300 m. As a consequence of highly fluctuating temperatures and rain a crust formed on the surface at the weekend.
Weak layers exist in the old snowpack on shady slopes.
Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to moistening of the snowpack on very steep south facing slopes at low and intermediate altitudes. These conditions will foster a gradual strengthening of the snowpack especially below approximately 3000 m.
At intermediate and high altitudes snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The weather conditions will foster a gradual change towards better conditions in all regions. The avalanche danger will decrease gradually.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: In all altitude zones from a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The snowpack will be generally stable.
Very isolated avalanche prone locations are to be found at high altitude and on extremely steep slopes. Mostly the avalanches in these loacations are small and can be released in isolated cases by a single winter sport participant. Restraint should be exercised because avalanches can sweep people along and give rise to falls.
The numerous rocks hidden by the recent snow are the main danger.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: In some localities 0 to 5 cm of snow fell on Sunday above approximately 2200 m. In all altitude zones only a little snow is now lying.
